title: Landscape with Elegant Figures by a River, with Boats to the Right and a Town Behind Trees Beyond

thumbnail.alt_text: A work made of brush and gray wash, with touches of white wash, over touches of charcoal, ruled in pen and brown ink, on ivory laid paper.

description: Evocative of a blustery spring day, this drawing by landscape specialist Everdingen includes a church with cloisters in the left background, a tower by the water’s edge at center, several boats navigating choppy water, and a group of figures looking into the composition instead of out toward the viewer. Everdingen is known to have created several series describing the months of the year, and a number 4 on the verso of this drawing suggests that it may have belonged to such a series, likely representing the month of April.
medium_display: Brush and gray wash, with touches of white wash, over touches of charcoal, ruled in pen and brown ink, on ivory laid paper
inscriptions: Signed recto, lower left, in gray wash: "AVE"; inscribed verso, in brown ink: "4"
credit_line: Gift of Dorothy Braude Edinburg to the Harry B. and Bessie K. Braude Memorial Collection
publication_history: Alice Davies, The Drawings of Allart van Everdingen: A Complete Catalogue (Doornspijk: Davaco, 2007), no. 147, p. 223 (ill.).
exhibition_history:
Art Institute of Chicago, The Thrill of the Chase: Drawings for the Harry B. and Bessie K. Braude Memorial Collection, Mar. 15–June 15, 2014, no cat.

The Art Institute of Chicago, "Rubens, Rembrandt, and Drawing in the Golden Age", September 28, 2019 - January 5, 2020.
provenance_text: Alexander Mangin (1732–1802), Dublin; sold, London, Mar. 29–Apr. 17, 1810, lot 1551, to Henry Fitzmaurice, Third Marquess of Lansdowne (1780–1863); by descent; sold, Christie's, Amsterdam, Nov. 22, 1982, lot 164.  Sold, Sotheby's, New York, Jan. 24, 2007, lot 52, to Dorothy Braude Edinburg, Brookline, Mass.; given to the Art Institute of Chicago, 2013.

input: Landscape with Elegant Figures by a River, with Boats to the Right and a Town Behind Trees Beyond
